page_analysis.page_narrative: Introduction of Leo's story - from narrator transition to meeting wife Ali about sleep problems to first therapy appointment

panels.scene_description: Rebecca (narrator) giving motivational framing about the program requiring commitment

characters.name: Rebecca
characters.expression: Earnest, slightly raised eyebrows, open mouth mid-speech, friendly
characters.pose: Facing viewer, one hand raised with open palm in explanatory gesture
characters.clothing: Pink blazer over white top, teal drop earrings

speech_bubbles: As cliché as it sounds - what you put in, is what you get out. The strategies described in this program are not complex. However, it does take motivation to put the strategies into place and to stick to them for several weeks.
We recommend that you consider the next couple of months as "boot camp" for your sleep.
Our courses have been shown to be highly effective, however the benefit is much less in those people who don't complete all of the lessons in the course.

panels.scene_description: Rebecca transitioning to introduce Leo's story

characters.name: Rebecca
characters.pose: Slight turn, gesturing to introduce the story
characters.clothing: Pink blazer over white top, teal earrings

speech_bubbles: Ok, it's time to meet Leo and get started with Lesson 1.

transformation_notes.name_reference: Leo mentioned in speech - would need text change for client name variant

panels.scene_description: Leo sitting on bed edge expressing frustration about sleep, Ali standing nearby showing concern
panels.setting: Bedroom - bed with grey bedding, nightstands with lamps, window with blinds, beige/brown walls

characters.name: Leo
characters.expression: Tired, hand on head showing frustration, furrowed brow
characters.pose: Sitting on edge of bed, hunched posture, one hand to head
characters.clothing: White tank top, blue and white striped pajama pants, barefoot

characters.name: Ali
characters.pose: Standing near bed, body turned toward Leo, gesturing while speaking
characters.clothing: Light blue/teal top, blue knee-length skirt

speech_bubbles: Another awful sleep - It's like I've lost my ability to sleep, Ali.
I know, hon. I heard you tossing and turning and saw you on your phone at 3am.

transformation_notes.relationship_dynamic_must_preserve: supportive partner concerned about client's sleep
transformation_notes.gender_swap_considerations: If Leo becomes female, Ali could remain female (same-sex couple) or become male partner

panels.scene_description: Continuation of bedroom conversation, Leo explaining symptoms, Ali concerned

characters.name: Leo
characters.expression: Explaining, slightly less distressed, looking at Ali
characters.pose: Still seated on bed edge, hands more animated in explanation

speech_bubbles: Yeah, I woke up at 2am and just couldn't get back to sleep.

panels.scene_description: Leo expressing hopelessness about sleep, Ali suggesting professional help
panels.setting: Same bedroom, slightly different angle showing more of room

characters.name: Leo
characters.expression: Frustrated, gesturing while explaining failed attempts
characters.pose: Seated, hands raised in frustrated gesture
characters.clothing: Same - tank top visible, pajama pants

speech_bubbles: Nothing major. I have that meeting at work today but I'm not too worried about it really. I'm just sick of not sleeping properly. I woke up, saw it was 2am and just thought, here we go again. Another bad sleep, another hopeless day tomorrow.
Do you think you should see someone about it?
I don't know. It's been like this for so long. Can anyone really help? I know about cutting out caffeine and all that stuff. Nothing seems to work.
You don't have much to lose. Why don't you see that psychologist Jon told you about?

therapeutic_elements.description: Partner suggesting professional help - models help-seeking behavior
therapeutic_elements.therapeutic_purpose: Normalizing seeking professional help for sleep problems

panels.scene_description: First meeting between Leo and Ian (psychologist) in therapy office
panels.setting: Therapy office - desk, bookshelf visible, plant, wooden furniture, window with blinds

characters.name: Ian
characters.pose: Seated at desk, leaning forward slightly, open welcoming gesture

speech_bubbles: I figured Ali was right so I made an appointment with the psychologist.
I used to be a pretty good sleeper but my trouble started after my second child was born.

therapeutic_elements.description: First therapy session - establishing therapeutic relationship
therapeutic_elements.therapeutic_purpose: Modeling positive first therapy experience, reducing stigma

transformation_notes.therapist_transformation: Could change therapist demographics but must maintain professional, warm presentation
transformation_notes.text_dependencies: Leo's name mentioned, Ali mentioned, 'second child' - family context

text_elements_requiring_update: Names in speech bubbles if doing name changes (Leo, Ali, Jon)
Family references ('second child') if adjusting family context

gender_swap_client.Ali_to_male_partner: Optional - could keep same-sex couple or swap to male

ethnicity_variant.rationale: Client and partner represent the user's story; narrator and therapist are guide figures
